Welcome

My name is Callum Apps and I'm a Computer
Science Student based in Reading, UK. You can
find more about me, my work and my
interests on GitHub or LinkedIn.

I'm a passionate Third-Year Computer Science student
enrolled at the University of Reading.
My journey in this dynamic field has equipped me with a diverse skill set that includes
proficiency in several programming languages such as Java, C, Python, JavaScript, and HTML/CSS.
For a comprehensive overview of my academic background, skills, and experiences,
please explore my About Me Page.

Experience

    • Having delved into the realm of Computer Science for the past 8 years, starting from my GCSE days and now pursuing advanced studies at the university level, my passion for computing has only deepened. A glance at my GitHub profile reveals a diverse array of projects, spanning from fundamental HTML/CSS to more intricate, object-oriented languages like C++ and Python.
      As I embark on a Graduate Software Engineer position, my aim is not only to thrive in the role but also to expand and refine my current skill set. The prospect of contributing to innovative projects and continuous learning in the dynamic landscape of software engineering excites me.

    • Currently, I am focused on refining my skills in C and Python programming languages, actively contributing to my GitHub with public revision guides aimed at helping others refresh their knowledge in these languages. This project not only allows me to delve into the fundamentals of Data Structures and Algorithms but also provides valuable support to fellow learners.
      Simultaneously, my attention is dedicated to my dissertation, where I am employing network programming to develop a distinctive platformer game that seamlessly combines 2D and 3D aspects. Balancing this with my ongoing coursework adds a dynamic and rewarding dimension to my current endeavors.

    • I am persuing a certification in C# from Microsoft and FreeCodeCamp aswell as having a few differnt Linkedin Certifications. However, I am most proud of my current grades at university, ranging from 65-100% in each of my pieces of coursework, averaging over 75% in my three years combined, and on track to receive a first class degree in BSc Computer Science!

    • I currently live in Reading, but I'll soon be relocating for my new job.
      Currently, I work as an IT Support Analyst for my university, where I assist staff and students with troubleshooting and other IT-related queries.
      Outside of work, I have a passion for traveling and exploring. My goal is to visit as many countries in Europe as possible!

Drone Simulator

This project was my first Java coursework in year 2 of university, which involved me having to create a system that simulated randomly moving, colliding drones.

View Project

Random Generating Maze

This involved me creating a randomly generating algorithm that ensured that there was always an exit; this was also my second Java coursework.

View Project

Networked Unity Application

My dissertation project focused on Networked Multiplayer Games. This project was done in Unity and used the Photon extension to host for free.
